Procs

proc count(word: string; chars: HashSet[char]): Table[char, int] {...}{.raises: [KeyError],
    tags: [].}
Similar to count in strutil here but it returns the count of each char in chars individually in a table.   Source Edit 
proc parseInt(num: char): int {...}{.raises: [NotADigitError], tags: [].}
Parse num into an int. Will raise NotADigitError if num is not a digit.   Source Edit 
proc parseInt(num: string): int {...}{.raises: [NotADigitError], tags: [].}
Parse num into an int. Will raise NotADigitError if num is not a digit.   Source Edit 
proc substr(s: var string; first, last: int): void {...}{.raises: [InvalidIndexError], tags: [].}
Similar to substr in system here but this is done in place.   Source Edit 
proc trim(s: var string): void {...}{.raises: [InvalidIndexError], tags: [].}
Trim whitespaces of the given string. Similar to strip in strutils here but this is done in place.   Source Edit

    raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Similar to multiReplace in strutils here but it takes in Table[string, string] instead of varargs[tuple(string, string)].   Source Edit

proc width(strs: seq[string]): seq[int] {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
A seq of str.len().   Source Edit 
proc find(str: string; open: char; close: char; toFind: string): seq[int] {...}{.raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Find location of toFind in str when the open and close character count is the same

Examples:

doAssert find("<A,B>,B", '<', '>', ",") == @[5]
doAssert find("A,<B,C>", '<', '>', ",") == @[1]
  Source Edit 
proc split(str: string; open: char; close: char; separator: string): seq[string] {...}{.
    raises: [], tags: [].}
Split string into a sequence of string based on the given info from find .

Examples:

doAssert split("<A,B>,B", '<', '>', ",") == @["<A,B>", "B"]
doAssert split("<A, <B, C>>, <A, <B, C>>, <X, Y>", '<', '>', ", ") ==
    @["<A, <B, C>>", "<A, <B, C>>", "<X, Y>"]
  Source Edit
